sentences.english: The existing injustices will soon be righted.
sentences.chinese: 现有的冤案不久将得到纠正。

sentences.english: Having no confession is a focus of Qiu Jins unjust case before her death.
sentences.chinese: 秋瑾死前没有供词是秋瑾冤案的一个焦点。

sentences.english: A terrible wrong has been done. Those men should never gone to prison.
sentences.chinese: 这事已经造成大冤案，那些人决不应该进监狱。

sentences.english: This recognition will be helpful for clearing up the injustice of Yao Nai in Chinese literary history.
sentences.chinese: 认清这一点，有助于澄清我国文学史上的这桩冤案。

sentences.english: The Emubu Event is an unjust case created by the rulers of Late Jin.
sentences.chinese: “俄木布事件”是后金统治者制造的冤案。

sentences.english: At long last the wrong has been righted.

definition: unjust, fake and false charges (in a legal case)
a misjudged legal case/a miscarriage (of justice)
unjust charge or verdict/miscarriage of justice/frame-up
to be wronged/to be subjected to an injustice
to exonerate/to clear (from an accusation)/to rehabilitate
to reverse a verdict/to present different views on a historical person or verdict
facts of an injustice/circumstances surrounding a miscarriage of justice
to redress (an injustice)/to rehabilitate (sb whose reputation was unjustly sullied)
lit. to wash out a grievance/fig. to right a wrong/to redress an injustice
